content.description:
Start on two slopey underclings, bump the left hand, and go to the ledge hold. Continue to the top.

 A proud bloc with some very, very thuggy climbing. Probably helps to be tall and have big hands. Described by Nalle in 2009 as "V11 no matter what the guide book would say".

Start on the right leaning slopey rail, and figure out how to dyno up and leftwards to the obvious jug.  Top out on the right leaning crack.  The very tall may be able to do this as a static mantle using a foot near the Vulgarian start.
content.location: On the Gunks boulder just to the right of The Vulgarian.

content.description:
Big holds up an overhang.  How can you go wrong?  Right as you walk into The Gunks this is the first climb past The Full Monty on the same side. Starts in the middle of the face and goes slightly left.   

  If you're not on jugs you are off route.
Tall Obvious line of Huecos, little bit of loose rock, but plenty of fun
content.location: on the backside of the Utep Boulder, to your right when hiking up towards New Religion/Fight or Flight

content.description:
Start sitting on a right undercling and left edge or sloper. Follow angling rails up and right over the lower boulder to the arete. Pull around and top out. 

  While low the landing is awkward and you can't cut your feet because of how close the boulder under you is, but the climbing is at least somewhat interesting.
content.location: On the main Gunks boulder. Starts below and right of Walrus in a Blender, but left of the low boulder.

content.description:
This line is pretty cool and has some really neat holds.  Unfortunatly the difficulty is a bit contrived as it is easier to go directly up from the start holds. 

  Sit start at the far left side of the boulder.  Climb rightwards on small flakes to a cool right hand pocket sidepull.  Slap up to the lip and finish slightly rightwards thru the hole between the two boulders.  Once at the lip both boulders are on, so you can chimney / flail / crawl thru the hole.  A little committing as it feels as though you may hit the back boulder if you fall while throwing for the lip.
content.location: On the Gunks boulder, about 20' left of "The Full Monty"

content.description: Start from a right hand under-cling with a thumb catch on the sharp tooth and a left hand gaston crimp. Drop knee and go left hand to the start of New Religion and then campus to match. Finish on New Religion.
content.location: Look for the chalked up under-cling side-pull underneath the start of New Religion.

content.description: A gym climbers dream.  Steep, positive holds, long moves, mellow topout.  A sit start exists that goes at V8.  If you don't have fun on this one something is wrong.
content.protection: Pads and a good spotter.  Landing slopes away.
content.location: Through the middle of The Gunks and up on the right; steep overhang with two large huecos at mid height.

content.description: the finish to Alf in a blender, start on the jug and go up and left, worth doing if your trying Alf, although you probably wont fall
Start low on start of Full Monty(?)grovel up the funky start move and traverse right on a bomber horizontal ledge, finish on the vulgarian
content.location: same start as full monty, but climb right. from the vulgarian look left for a very low start

content.description: climb up through interesting pockets, not a bad warm up for the area
content.protection: pad, be mindful of the boulder to your back
content.location: far left of the Monkees Boulder

climbs.name: The Hunger Artist aka Alf in a Blender

content.description: An amazing classic.  Start on a two hand undercling under the roof.  Slap out the sloping left hand rail, apply some foot trickery and make you way onto better holds.  Many ways to approach this one.  Once you piece it together it seems easier.
content.location: Across from The Vulgarian and Walrus in a Blender  and under the roof right in the middle of The Gunks.

climbs.name: Hey, Hey, Hey We're the Monkeys

content.description: Sit start on an obvious jug on the middle / right side of the boulder.  Figure out how to make a big move leftwards to a large hueco.  Get the horizontal crack and traverse left some more to finish up "Last Train To Clarksville" V1
content.protection: Pad for start, bad and spotter on rock behind for finish.
content.location: On the Monkees boulder directly across from "The Full Monty".  Starts in the middle / right side of the boulder.

content.description: Sit start from two obvious huecos, figure a way to get to the starting jug of the stand, and execute. Cool additional moves, arguably the more natural line to those who like sit starts.

Start on a high left facing hueco and move upward through sequential moves on flakes that get increasingly worse as you go.  Match the top flake and make a heady move to the top of the boulder.  Match and pull over to the finish.  The book lists this as a challenging mantel, but with the right holds it shouldn't feel too bad.  Might be a good idea to pre-inspect the topout if you are at your limit. 

  There is also a sit start to this that adds in a few moves and bumps the grade up to V6.
content.protection: Pads, preferably lots of them.  The landing zone slopes away so you are quite high by the time you get to the top.
content.location: On the backside of the Gunks boulder.  Almost directly opposite New Religion.

content.description:
Very striking line up the steep corner with a finger crack to a moderately difficult but quite high top out onto a slab. The only real line on the wall. 

  Get your right hand as high in the corner as you can and stand up. Arrange your feet into some sort of a wide stem and pull up as high as you can. There is a sloping edge a bit below where the crack actually opens up that you can pause on to readjust your feet or just bump off of. Claw for where the crack opens. Then get your feet up and match. Layback up the corner eventually with good feet out right till you get to the lip. Reach up to the lip and grab some good slopers and pull over to the right or more straight up. 

  Graded V4 in the guide book. It might be V4 if you are well over 6 feet tall or you somehow don't take into account the first moves.
content.protection: Pads, lots and spotters, the bigger the better.
content.location: From New Religion, walk between New Religion and the Gunks boulder then around to the back of the next big boulder on your left. You will be greeted with a 30 degree overhung wall with a slanted landing. Walk up the slope till you see the obvious right facing corner that starts at about head height and has a finger crack in it.

content.description:
Really fun climbing that tempts a poor landing when you move over the edge of the boulder below. To bad the crux is not dabbing on the boulder once you are over it. 

  Start New Religion and climb through the crux of that problem. Then head out right on huecos and flakes until you are over the boulder to the right of New Religion and top out at the jutting block horn feature.
content.protection: Pad and spotter, you might want a pad on the lip of the boulder until you are over it then get rid of it to give yourself some extra space.
content.location: Starts the same as New Religion and moves right after the crux of that problem.

content.description:
Start on jugs to the left in the roof, a couple of moves head right to a threader jug. A big move out right to the arete starts the business, cool compression follows the steep arete to good holds at the lip. 

  This problem would be pretty amazing if it was 3-5 feet higher off the ground, though dabbing was not really an issue. 

  Originally graded V10, the grade seems to have settled at V8.  

  There might be a knee bar somewhere but I did not see anything that would be useful, though I suck at knee barring.
content.protection: Pads for the inevitable backslaps and a spot for where you could potentially swing into the bush behind and to the right of the problem.
content.location: From Full Monty, head left through a hole and over some boulders towards Windy Ass. You will walk over the flat top of a boulder. After you cross the boulder look back underneath.

content.description: Stand start on crimps down in pit. Climb up and right on great incut holds to top out.
content.location: Below the Gunks and above the Maze, downhill from Bush League and Windy Ass.

content.description: This line while given no stars in the Wilder guide, is probably worth at least one, and worth doing if you're looking for something new in the area.  Start at the left side of the horizontal crack.  Climb up and rightward utilizing a cool pocket, to get established in a large dish.  Trivial moves lead up to the top of the boulder.
content.protection: Pads & Spotter, has a flat landing
content.location: On the Monkees boulder directly across from "The Full Monty".  Starts in the middle of the boulder.

content.description: Stand start from the left large hueco and traverse to the right into New Religion.
content.location: To the left of New Religion

content.description:
Where it starts getting real confusing. Essentially climbing Bad Religion backwards, start on New Religion, do the first move, and then traverse left to finish on All The Idiots. V8ish.

 You could also start on New Religion Sit...V9ish. Also heard of it as Good Religion.
Start sitting in the big hueco. Work up, left, and around the arete.
content.location: Left side of New Religion wall.

content.description: This area has shaded problems when the sun is out.  Classic problems abound from V2 - V12.  Some of them include: The Vulgarian (V2), Fight or Flight (V4), Walrus in a Blender (V5), The Hunger Artist aka Alf in a Blender (V6), New Religion (V7), and The Full Monty (V12).
